The survey covers all businesses in New Zealand that have 6 more employees, and have been active for one year or more.

title: Central Government Enterprise Survey

The data collected by this survey is needed to compile quarterly and annual statistics on the performance of the New Zealand economy, such as calculating gross domestic product (GDP) and statistics on Crown research institutes.

title: Child and Youth Prosecution Statistics - tables (NZ.Stat)
description: The Ministry of Justice provides data to Stats NZ about children (aged 10-13) and young people (aged 14-16) charged in court for official release on the Stats NZ website.  Children and young people who are convicted of an offence in the District or High Court are included in the Youth Prosecution Statistics as well as those whose charges are proved in the Youth Court. All numbers in the Youth Prosecution Statistics are rounded to the nearest multiple of three, with the exception of zeroes, which remain as zeroes. The Youth Court is closed to the public, so any details that may identify an individual young person cannot be reported.
keywords: Children, Crime and justice, Gender and sex, Society
publisher.name: Statistics NZ

title: Crown Financial Information System
description: Crown Financial Information System (CFIS) is sourced from Treasury.  An analysis which records the financial transactions of the Crown with all other economic sectors, such as private enterprise, households, local government, state owned enterprises and the rest of the world, is also prepared from the data source.The financial data collected by CFIS is needed to compile quarterly and annual statistics on the performance of the New Zealand economy.  The information is used in the calculation of the Gross Domestic Product, which measures the value of goods less the cost of production.  The information is also used to compile the Analysis of the Crown Accounts.

title: Historical de facto population estimates
description: De facto population estimates include all people present in New Zealand and counted by the census (census night population count). De facto estimates include visitors from overseas who are counted on census night, but exclude New Zealand residents who are temporarily overseas. The estimated de facto population at a given date after census includes births, deaths and net migration (arrivals less departures) of people during the period between census night and the given date. De facto population estimates are no longer produced.
keywords: Population and migration, De facto, Historical estimates, De facto, Historical, Estimates
publisher.name: Statistics NZ
distribution.0.title: Metadata
distribution.1.title: Dataset

title: Household Econmic Survey (Expenditure)
description: The Household Economic Survey (HES) is an annual survey that collects information on income, housing costs, material wellbeing and demographic information on households and individuals in New Zealand. There are three versions of the HES, including HES (Income), HES (Expenditure) and HES (Savings). The HES (Income) is the primary content and is collected every year, but combined with HES (Expenditure) and HES (Savings) alternately in the two years  in between the standalone HES every year.
keywords: Expenditure,  Fiscal,  Income,  open government,  tax and economics, Households

title: National Accounts (1994-2011)
description: The National Accounts releases provided statistics on economic aggregates such as gross domestic product, capital formation, and government and private consumption. This release has been discontinued. Content previously available in this release is now available in National Accounts (Income and Expenditure)
keywords: Economic Indicators, Fiscal, National Accounts, open government, tax and economics

title: National Accounts input-output tables
description: Input-output tables are a powerful analytical tool for describing the structure of New Zealand’s economy. They show the relationships between industries, the goods and services they produce, and who uses them.

title: New Zealand Business Demography Statistics
description:
These releases provide an annual snapshot of the structure and characteristics of New Zealand businesses.  
Statistics produced include counts of enterprises and geographic units by industry, region, institutional sector, business type, degree of overseas ownership, enterprise births, enterprise deaths, survival rate of enterprises and employment levels. The series covers economically significant private-sector and public-sector enterprises that are engaged in the production of goods and services in New Zealand.
keywords: Businesses, Enterprises
publisher.name: Statistics NZ

title: New Zealand Income Survey
description: This survey was discontinued in 2016. It provided income statistics alongside information about personal and household characteristics. title: Overseas Merchandise Trade
description: This information release provides statistical information on the importing and exporting of merchandise goods between New Zealand and other countries. Merchandise trade includes goods which add to or subtract from the material resources in New Zealand as a result of their movement in or out of the country. Data is obtained from the New Zealand Customs Service.

title: Regional Economic Indicator
description: The Regional Economic Indicator (REI) was an experimental time series, produced quarterly.  The REI produced GST Sales and GST Purchases at Regional Council Level by Industry and by Industrial sector. GST administrative data sourced from the Business Activity Indicator (BAI) is allocated to regional council level using business frame, business demography and meshblock data.  The REI was published in the Quarterly Regional Review, a customised output, offered to customers by subscription.  Data is also available directly on request.  The REI series is used by local government, economists, industry analysts and researchers.
publisher.name: Statistics NZ
distribution.1.title: Use Infoshare to view and download time-series data

title: Statistics NZ Annual Report (Financial Statements)
